page.title: 15INGLEBY ARNCLIFFE C.E.SCHOOL
page.content: The school at Ingleby Arncliffe is voluntary aided by the Church of England being in the care of the diocese of York.It was opened in 1973 to replace the old schools in I.A.and East Harlsey,a village 3miles away. Children from both villages attend the school.The old school in I.A., built in 1869, is now a private home. 57 children are on roll with a staff of 2 full-time and a part-time teacher. Mrs.C.Edwards is the headteacher. As well as classrooms, there is a hall and a kitchen where meals are cooked not only for this school but for Osmotherley and Silton schools.Outside there is a playground and playing field.Mrs.Mann,the caretaker has worked there for 26 years. She has not had a single day off work. She began her job on the day her daughter started at the school.
